p: We used IFRC SDB data on the time and location of 6491 individual burials, conducted over 25 weeks, between Oct 17, 2014 and April 3, 2015 in four districts in Sierra Leone: the capital district of Western Area Urban, the adjacent district of Western Area Rural, and the districts of Bo and Bombali. Data for 4020 (61.9%) of the burials included the results of laboratory testing of a skin swab sample for Ebola. In this subset, 386 (9.6%) burials tested positive for Ebola. These data were available for each district and week.
